articles.author: Bridge Group Solutions
articles.description:
VPN stands for Virtual Private Network and it's essentially an invisibility cloak for your internet traffic. When you connect to the internet through a VPN, your data gets encrypted and routed through a secure server. 
VPN or Virtual Private Network is not something from The Matrix. It‚Äôs a tool that creates a secure, encrypted tunnel between your device and the internet. Think of it like a secret underground tunnel for your data, away from the prying eyes of cybercriminals.
Work from coffee shops without panic-sweating every time I opened a new tab
Here‚Äôs what I now recommend after several trials, errors, and one very sketchy free VPN that tried to install a toolbar from 2007:
No-logs policy ‚Äì You want a VPN that doesn‚Äôt track or store what you‚Äôre doing. Privacy means privacy.
Fast speeds ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Securing Remote Work Environments with VPNs

articles.author: Taqmuraz
articles.description:
It's just a tool


Game engine is a tool, so it may be analyzed and rated. In order to do so, we need to understand, what game engine is.
I present my own definition : game engine is an abstraction layer over separate autonomous systems : graphics, physics, sound, networking, user input, storage. Design of such abstraction layer may vary.
This is what game engine must be. Flexible, customizable for almost any needs. Now let's find a definition for modern and popular game engines, such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Godot : an ecosystem, that provides means for user to create games, including a visual editor for game contents and assets.
Answering short, best architecture is no architecture.
entity component system (ECS), MVC or OOP patterns.
I personally would recommend dynamically typed languages with FFI (foreign function interface) to C or Java.
Python, Groovy, Lua or similar.
dynamically typed language.
Following idea of this article, best game engine is no game engine.
My definition of game engine is very close to that. Game engine must be a thin abstraction layer over separate independent systems, so after you just write game logic.
Mostly, game programmers don't understand their desires. What game they want to do. So, they choose a game engine to make an AAA game, usually it's Unity or Unreal Engine. And, usually they end up making 2D platformers or 3D hyper-casual games with low-poly graphics.
Unity, Unreal Engine and Godot give their users an illusion of comprehension and development, while they don't clearly understand how most of systems work.
Instead of choosing game engine, choose programming language and libraries, and start writing games. You will thank me later.
articles.title: Choosing game engine in 2025

Essa abordagem evita a necessidade de tratamentos extras caso o usu√°rio altere a URL manualmente.
Utilizaremos um cookie para identificar e armazenar o idioma selecionado pelo usu√°rio. Esse cookie ser√° definido automaticamente no primeiro acesso ao site. Caso o usu√°rio deseje alterar o idioma depois, ser√° poss√≠vel fazer essa mudan√ßa pela plataforma desenvolvida.

articles.title: Como implementar internacionaliza√ß√£o (i18n) em um projeto Next.js sem alterar a URL

articles.author: Junior
articles.description:
In this article, I will objectively and directly show how to implement internationalization (i18n) in a Next.js project using next-intl, without tying languages to the URL paths ‚Äî in other words, no paths like example.com/en. This approach avoids the need for extra handling in case the user manually changes the URL.
We'll use a cookie to identify and store the user's selected language. This cookie will be automatically set on the user's first visit to the site. If the user wishes to change the language later, they‚Äôll be able to do so through the developed platform.
If you don‚Äôt have a Next.js project set up yet, you can follow this tutorial: How to set up a new Next.js project.
Now, install the next-intl package, which will help us configure i18n.
npm  install  next-intl

Let‚Äôs structure t‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to implement internationalization (i18n) in a Next.js project without changing the URL

articles.author: Julia Amatuni
articles.description:
This is the second article of the series How to Learn to Code in an AI World. Don‚Äôt miss the first, Is it Still Worth Learning to Code?
Imagine the following scenario:
A student is enrolled in an introductory computer science course. They have no previous programming experience and don‚Äôt consider themselves very good at math or technical subjects. In this course, the teacher allows the use of large language models like ChatGPT and AI code completion software to help students with their work.
When completing a homework assignment, the student carefully reads the prompt and begins to code. Almost immediately, an AI code suggestion tool generates a long function, which overwhelms them, prompting them to turn to ChatGPT instead. Believing it‚Äôs best to use AI as a tutor rather than an answer ma‚Ä¶
articles.title: Learning to Think in an AI World: 5 Lessons for Novice Programmers

articles.author: Beatrice Egumandi
articles.description:
One is clean, scalable, and built for teams.
This isn‚Äôt a formal technical term, it‚Äôs more of a vibe‚Ä¶ an elite one.
When someone says, ‚ÄúWe do state-of-the-art programming‚Äù they‚Äôre really saying:
We write smart, clean, scalable code using the best tools and practices modern development has to offer.
No legacy stuff. No spaghetti coding. Definitely no commit messages like final_reallyfinal_FIX.
Modern workflows: Trunk-Based Development, GitOps, CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code.


Architecture: Clean Architecture, Ports and Adapters, CQRS, Microservices (if you must).


Best practices: SOLID principles, DRY, TDD/BDD, Domain-Driven Design, Version control strategies that don‚Äôt leave your git log looking like a crime scene.


High-quality tooling: TypeScript (because JavaScript is a litt‚Ä¶
articles.title: üß† State-of-the-Art Programming vs üéß Vibe Coding: A Tale of Two Dev Modes

The Ultimate Guide to Self-Love: Nurturing Yourself From the Inside Out


Meta Description: Discover the power of self-love! Learn practical tips and strategies to cultivate self-compassion, build confidence, and create a happier, healthier you.
Keywords: self-love, self-compassion, self-care, self-esteem, confidence, mental health, well-being, mindfulness, personal growth, happiness
Slug: the-ultimate-guide-to-self-love
In today's fast-paced world, it's easy to get caught up in external pressures and forget about the most important relationship you'll ever have: the one with yourself. Self-love isn't selfish; it's foundational. It's the bedrock upon which a fulfilling and meaningful life is built. This guide will explore what self-love truly means, why it's essential, and provide practica‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Ultimate Guide to Self-Love: Nurturing Yourself From the Inside Out

articles.author: Bridge Group Solutions
articles.description:
The Day My App Almost Got Me Fired


You ever have one of those days where you think everything's fine‚Äîyour app is running smoothly, your coffee‚Äôs just the right level of burnt, and you‚Äôre actually caught up on Slack‚Äîwhen suddenly, disaster strikes?
For me, it was a push notification I didn‚Äôt expect: "Urgent: Unauthorized access detected. You might wanna check that.‚Äù
It felt like the floor disappeared under me.
I‚Äôve worked in mobile app development for nearly a decade now. And I‚Äôll be honest‚Äîwhen I first started, security was something we ‚Äúgot to eventually.‚Äù You know, after MVP, bug fixes, 16 other feature requests, and maybe lunch. But after that password debacle? Mobile app security became the priority. Right alongside caffeine.
So yeah, this post isn‚Äôt about ‚Äúbest practices‚Äù from a tex‚Ä¶
articles.title: Securing Mobile Apps Against Emerging Cyber Threats

articles.author: Chris Villa
articles.description:
Puck 0.19 introduces the Slots API, the powerful successor to DropZones that lets you nest components using a field. This new approach allows you to define drop areas and their content programmatically using defaultProps and resolveData, enabling sophisticated patterns like component templates:

In addition to Slots, this release brings major performance improvements, a new metadata API for passing data into every component, and many quality-of-life upgrades.
In this post, we'll walk through everything new in Puck 0.19 and how to start using it:
What's new in Puck 0.19
Other changes
How to upgrade
Full changelog
Contributors
If you're upgrading from a previous version, be sure to check the upgrade guide for breaking changes and migration tips. 
You can also find detailed docs for each new ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Puck 0.19: Slots API & performance gains

articles.author: Oussama Belhadi
articles.description:
Teamwork: Mastering the Art of Working with Anyone


Learning to navigate differences and finding ways to work effectively with different kinds of people isn‚Äôt just smart, it‚Äôs a practical strategy to get things done without losing your mind.
If you take the time to notice people around you, you'll find that they all have unique styles in the way they talk, how they work, and what motivates or drives them. Each person has a distinct personality that may appeal to you because it‚Äôs relatable, or bother you because you can‚Äôt comprehend the way they think, feel, and act.
But we hardly pay attention to others. We hardly take the time to understand what makes them act a certain way. Not understanding others not only leads to misunderstandings, frustration, and conflict, it makes us miserable bec‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Work With Different People on Your Team
